articles.author: Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Israeli forces killed a local commander of the Islamist movement Hamas in the flashpoint city of Jenin on Friday as they pressed a major operation in the occupied West Bank for a third day, the Israeli military said.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill local Hamas commander in West Bank

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Luana Benedito, Ricardo Brito
articles.description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice ordered on Friday the "immediate suspension" of social media platform X in the country, after a court-imposed deadline expired for the company to identify a legal representative in Brazil.
articles.title: Judge orders Musk's X immediately shut down in Brazil

articles.author: Gabriel Stargardter
articles.description: The investigation into Telegram boss Pavel Durov that has fired a warning shot to global tech titans was started by a small cybercrime unit within the Paris prosecutor's office, led by 38-year-old Johanna Brousse.
articles.title: Behind the arrest of Telegram boss, a small Paris cybercrime unit with big ambitions

articles.author: Steve Gorman, Jorge Garcia
articles.description: One of two doctors who are among the five people charged in the ketamine overdose death of "Friends" star Matthew Perry was barred by a federal judge on Friday from practicing medicine and through his lawyer afterward expressed remorse.
articles.title: Doctor charged in death of 'Friends' star Matthew Perry 'incredibly remorseful'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A woman who survived the massacre of hundreds of villagers in central Burkina Faso described the horror of searching through bodies to find her brothers, in an interview following the attack claimed by an Al Qaeda-linked group earlier this week.
articles.title: Burkina Faso massacre survivor describes 'horrible' bloodshed in trenches

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One of the most infamous drug lords in Mexico's history, Osiel Cardenas, was released from prison on Friday, the U.S. Federal Bureau of Prisons said.
articles.title: Infamous Mexican drug lord released from US prison into immigration custody

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: United Nations officials are preparing to launch a polio vaccination campaign in Gaza on Sunday that will rely on a series of limited pauses in fighting between Israeli forces and Hamas militants holding out in the besieged enclave.
articles.title: UN's Gaza polio vaccinations will rely on pauses in fighting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian guided bomb attack on Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv hit a residential building and a playground, killing four people, including a child, and injuring at least 28 more, local authorities said.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv kills four, injures 28

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cuban health authorities launched small-scale fumigation efforts in Havana on Friday to fight the spread of the Oropouche virus, but a rainy Caribbean summer, fuel shortages and growing roadside trash heaps are complicating those efforts, workers and officials said.
articles.title: Cuba faces uphill battle as Oropouche virus spreads

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NASA said on Friday it will replace two crew members for an upcoming SpaceX flight to accommodate the two astronauts aboard the International Space Station who had arrived on Boeing's faulty Starliner capsule.
articles.title: NASA narrows Crew-9 lineup to accommodate astronauts aboard ISS
